Quote: The immature think that knowledge and action are different, but the wise see them as the same.

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: We read the Golden Rule and judge it to be a brilliant distillation of many of our ethical impulses. And then we come across another of God’s teachings on morality: if a man discovers on his wedding night that his bride is not a virgin, he must stone her to death on her father’s doorstep (Deuteronomy 22:13-21).

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: In the year 2006, a person can have sufficient intellectual and material resources to build a nuclear bomb and still believe that he will get seventy-two virgins in Paradise.

Author: Michael Crichton,  Next
Quote: Anyone who says he knows God's intention is showing a lot of very human ego.

Author: David Sedaris,  Me Talk Pretty One Day
Quote: The rabbit of Easter. He bring of the chocolate.

Author: Hlovate,  Versus
Quote: Bukan mudah untuk berubah... dari tanpa arah ke sejadah, dari tepi jalanan ke sujud menghadap Tuhan.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: With a truly tragic delusion,” Carl Jung noted, “these theologians fail to see that it is not a matter of proving the existence of the light, but of blind people who do not know that their eyes could see. It is high time we realized that it is pointless to praise the light and preach it if nobody can see it. It is much more needful to teach people the art of seeing.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Don’t be disheartened by the forces of evil. Nothing can happen that God hasn’t allowed. Even resistance is all part of grand orchestration. The devil always has you right were God wants you.

Author: Randa Abdel-Fattah,  Does My Head Look Big In This?
Quote: What’s the good of being true to your religion on the outside, if you don’t change what’s on the inside,were it really counts ?

Author: Ming-Dao Deng
Quote: All teachings are mere references. The true experience is living your own life. Then, even the holiest of words are only words.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Republicans are for both the man and the dollar, but in case of conflict the man before the dollar.

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: We know enough at this moment to say that the God of Abraham is not only unworthy of the immensity of creation; he is unworthy even of man.

Author: Sam Harris,  Letter to a Christian Nation
Quote: The fact that my continuous and public rejection of Christianity does not worry me in the least should suggest to you just how inadequate I think your reasons for being a Christian are.

Author: Stephen R. Covey
Quote: We are not human beings on a spiritual journey. We are spiritual beings on a human journey.

Author: Merritt Y. Hughes,  Ten Perspectives on Milton
Quote: God is the supreme uncreated light of which Wisdom is born, but there was never a time when God's Wisdom did not exist.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: Grant me, O Lord my God, a mind to know you, a heart to seek you, wisdom to find you, conduct pleasing to you, faithful perseverance in waiting for you, and a hope of finally embracing you. Amen.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: The religion of one age is the literary entertainment of the next.

Author: Amit Ray,  Yoga and Vipassana: An Integrated Life Style
Quote: Yoga is the art work of awareness on the canvas of body, mind, and soul.

Author: Albert Schweitzer,  Reverence for Life: The Words of Albert Schweitzer
Quote: He who does not reflect his life back to God in gratitude does not know himself.

Author: Dave Barry
Quote: Hobbies of any kind are boring except to people who have the same hobby. This is also true of religion, although you will not find me saying so in print.

Author: Henry B. Eyring
Quote: God not only loves the obedient - He enlightens them.

Author: Alice Walker,  The Color Purple
Quote: Man corrupt everything, say Shug. He on your box of grits, in your head, and all over the radio. He try to make you think he everywhere. Soon as you think he everywhere, you think he God. But he ain't. Whenever you trying to pray, and man plop himself on the other end of it, tell him to git lost, say Shug. Conjure up the flowers, wind, water, a big rock.

Author: Democritus
Quote: Nothing exists except atoms and empty space; everything else is opinion.

Author: Barbara Kingsolver,  The Poisonwood Bible
Quote: I could never work out whether we were to view religion as a life-insurance policy or a life sentence. I can understand a wrathful God who'd just as soon dangle us all from a hook. And I can understand a tender, unprejudiced Jesus. But I could never quite feature the two of them living in the same house. You wind up walking on eggshells, never knowing which... is at home at the moment.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Self-Reliance and Other Essays
Quote: I like the silent church before the service begins, better than any preaching.

Author: Francine Rivers,  A Voice in the Wind
Quote: Never doubt God in the darkness what he has given us in the light.

Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
Quote: God's gifts put men's best dreams to shame.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: What we want is not more little books about Christianity, but more little books by Christians on other subjects--with their Christianity latent.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: Yet the ivory gods, And the ebony gods, And the gods of diamond-jade, Are only silly puppet gods That people themselves Have made.-

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Small Gods
Quote: There are hardly any excesses of the most crazed psychopath that cannot easily be duplicated by a normal kindly family man who just comes in to work every day and has a job to do.

Author: Maria Semple,  Where'd You Go, Bernadette
Quote: Maybe that’s what religion is, hurling yourself off a cliff and trusting that something bigger will take care of you and carry you to the right place.

Author: Richard Bach,  Jonathan Livingston Seagull
Quote: We choose our next world through what we learn in this one. Learn nothing, and the next world is the same as this one, all the same limitations and lead weights to overcome.

Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi
Quote: Even when God seemed to have abandoned me, he was watching. Even when he seemed indifferent to my suffering, he was watching. And when I was beyond all hope of saving, he gave me rest. Then he gave me a sign to continue my journey.

Author: Daniel C. Dennett
Quote: You don't get to advertise all the good that your religion does without first scrupulously subtracting all the harm it does and considering seriously the question of whether some other religion, or no religion at all, does better.

Author: Ruth Hurmence Green
Quote: I studied every page of this book, and I didn't find enough love to fill a salt shaker. God is not love in the Bible; God is vengeance, from Alpha to Omega.

Author: H.L. Mencken
Quote: The trouble with Communism is the Communists, just as the trouble with Christianity is the Christians.

Author: Hannah Harrington,  Saving June
Quote: I hate organized religion. I hate that people use it to justify their crappy, bigoted beliefs.

Author: Frank Warren,  PostSecret: Confessions on Life, Death, and God
Quote: Religious people fear hell -- Spiritual people have walked thru it.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Woman is the light of God.

Author: Banksy
Quote: At this time of year it's easy to forget the true meaning of Christianity - the lies, the corruption, the abuse.

Author: Christopher Marlowe,  Dr. Faustus
Quote: Mephistopheles: Why, this is hell, nor am I out of it.Think'st thou that I, who saw the face of GodAnd tasted the eternal joys of heaven,Am not tormented with ten thousand hellsIn being deprived of everlasting bliss?

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Cat's Cradle
Quote: She was a fool, and so am I, and so is anyone who thinks he sees what God is Doing, [writes Bokonon].

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: اذا كان الانسان مع الله كان الله معه وأرسل له عند الحاجة علامات تدل على ذلك.

Author: Thomas Paine,  The Age of Reason
Quote: Persecution is not an original feature in any religion; but it is always the strongly marked feature of all religions established by law.

Author: Jeannette Walls,  Half Broke Horses
Quote: If you want to be reminded of the love of the Lord, just watch the sunrise.

Author: Wm. Paul Young,  The Shack
Quote: So no, I’m not too big on religion...and not very fond of politics or economics either...And why should I be? They are the man-created trinity of terrors that ravages the earth and deceives those I care about. What mental turmoil and anxiety does any human face that is not related to one of those three?

Author: Susan B. Anthony
Quote: I was born a heretic. I always distrusted people who know so much about what God wants them to do to their fellows.

Author: Harry S. Truman
Quote: We must remember that the test of our religious principles lies not just in what we say, not only in our prayers, not even in living blameless lives - but in what we do for others

Author: Aldous Huxley
Quote: You never see animals going through the absurd and often horrible fooleries of magic and religion. . . . Only man behaves with such gratuitous folly. It is the price he has to pay for being intelligent but not, as yet, quite intelligent enough.

Author: Eliezer Yudkowsky,  Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality
Quote: There is no justice in the laws of nature, no term for fairness in the equations of motion. The Universe is neither evil, nor good, it simply does not care. The stars don't care, or the Sun, or the sky. But they don't have to! WE care! There IS light in the world, and it is US!

Author: Blaise Pascal,  Pensées
Quote: If we submit everything to reason our religion will be left with nothing mysterious or supernatural. If we offend the principles of reason our religion will be absurd and ridiculous . . . There are two equally dangerous extremes: to exclude reason, to admit nothing but reason.

Author: Bill Maher
Quote: I think religion is a neurological disorder.

Author: James McBride,  The Color of Water: A Black Man's Tribute to His White Mother
Quote: God is the color of water. Water doesn't have a color.

Author: Bertrand Russell,  Why I Am Not a Christian and Other Essays on Religion and Related Subjects
Quote: Science can teach us, and I think our hearts can teach us, no longer to look around for imaginary supporters, no longer to invent allies in the sky, but rather to look to our own efforts here below to make the world a fit place to live.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Quote: The argument goes something like this: "I refuse to prove that I exist,"says God, "for proof denies faith, and without faith I am nothing.

Author: Napoléon Bonaparte
Quote: Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.

Author: Swami Vivekananda,  Raja-Yoga
Quote: Was there ever a more horrible blasphemy than the statement that all the knowledge of God is confined to this or that book? How dare men call God infinite, and yet try to compress Him within the covers of a little book!

Author: William Lane Craig,  Reasonable Faith
Quote: ‎"If there is no God, then man and the universe are doomed. Like prisoners condemned to death, we await our unavoidable execution. There is no God, and there is no immortality. And what is the consequence of this? It means that life itself is absurd. It means that the life we have is without ultimate significance, value, or purpose.

Author: Robert E. Lee
Quote: I can only say that I am nothing but a poor sinner, trusting in Christ alone for salvation.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Like when you sit in front of a fire in winter — you are just there in front of the fire. You don't have to be smart or anything. The fire warms you.

Author: Plato
Quote: He was a wise man who invented God.

Author: Sandra Day O'Connor
Quote: Those who would renegotiate the boundaries between church and state must therefore answer a difficult question: why would we trade a system that has served us so well for one that has served others so poorly?

Author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti
Quote: The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful and has nobody to thank.

Author: Max Lucado
Quote: Don't measure the size of the mountain; talk to the One who can move it.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: God’s word is not just to be heard and repeated, it is to be breathed, lived, and emulated with each action.

Author: George Burns
Quote: The secret of a good sermon is to have a good beginning and a good ending; and to have the two as close together as possible.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: All the cunning of the devil is exercised in trying to tear us away from the word.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: If you have to say or do something controversial, aim so that people will hate that they love it and not love that they hate it.

Author: Dag Hammarskjöld,  Markings
Quote: Your cravings as a human animal do not become a prayer just because it is God whom you ask to attend to them.

Author: Steve Brown,  Approaching God: Accepting the Invitation to Stand in the Presence of God
Quote: If there is no laughter, Jesus has gone somewhere else. If there is no joy and freedom, it is not a church: it is simply a crowd of melancholy people basking in a religious neurosis. If there is no celebration, there is no real worship.

Author: Pier Paolo Pasolini
Quote: If you know that I am an unbeliever, then you know me better than I do myself. I may be an unbeliever, but I am an unbeliever who has a nostalgia for a belief.

Author: Billy Graham
Quote: We are the Bibles the world is reading; We are the creeds the world is needing; We are the sermons the world is heeding.

Author: Czesław Miłosz
Quote: A true opium of the people is a belief in nothingness after death - the huge solace of thinking that for our betrayals, greed, cowardice, murders we are not going to be judged.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  Mistborn: The Final Empire
Quote: Are there any religions on your list that include the slaughter of noblemen as a holy duty?

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  Words of Radiance
Quote: Jasnah had once defined a fool as a person who ignored information because it disagreed with desired results.

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon,  Spurgeon's Sermons Vol. 1-10
Quote: ‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎‎The mind of God is greater than all the minds of men, so let all men leave the gospel just as God has delivered it unto us.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: Faith is a fine inventionWhen gentlemen can see,But microscopes are prudentIn an emergency.

Author: Ernest Becker,  The Denial of Death
Quote: We are gods with anuses.

Author: Ali Shariati
Quote: My father chose my name , and my last name was chosen by my ancestors . That’s enough, I myself choose my way

Author: Diana Wynne Jones
Quote: This is the mythosphere. It's made up of all the stories, theories and beliefs, legends, myths and hopes, that are generated here on Earth. As you can see, it's constantly growing and moving as people invent new tales to tell or find new things to believe. The older strands move out to become these spirals, where things tend to become quite crude and dangerous. They've hardened off, you see.

Author: Robert Clark
Quote: When asked why I don't believe in God I reply, quite simply, "vaginas".

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  The Miracle of Mindfulness: An Introduction to the Practice of Meditation
Quote: Those who are without compassion cannot see what is seen with the eyes of compassion.

Author: A.W. Tozer,  The Knowledge of the Holy
Quote: Faith is an organ of knowledge, and love an organ of experience.

Author: Henri Michaux
Quote: He who has rejected his demons badgers us to death with his angels

Author: Margaret Mead
Quote: It is easier to change a man's religion than to change his diet.

Author: جمال البنا,  هل يمكن تطبيق الشريعة؟
Quote: لو كان للأديان بصمة لكان العدل بصمة الإسلام

Author: Martin Buber
Quote: Everyone must come out of his Exile in his own way.

Author: Max Lucado,  Outlive Your Life: You Were Made to Make A Difference
Quote: No one can do everything, but everyone can do something

Author: Jim Butcher,  Death Masks
Quote: I wouldn't burden any decent system of faith by participating in it... I'm not agnostic. Just nonpartisan. Theological Switzerland, that's me.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.

Author: Ruth Hurmence Green
Quote: I feel that we should stop wasting our time trying to please the supernatural and concentrate on improving the welfare of human beings. I think that, uh, we should use our energy and our initiative to solve our problems, and stop relying on prayer and wishful thinking. If we have faith in ourselves, we won't have to have faith in gods.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: I don't believe in an afterlife, so I don't have to spend my whole life fearing hell, or fearing heaven even more. For whatever the tortures of hell, I think the boredom of heaven would be even worse.

Author: Annette Hoggs-Jackson
Quote: In order to know who you are you need to know God is.

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: The problem with religion, because it's been sheltered from criticism, is that it allows people to believe en masse what only idiots or lunatics could believe in isolation.

Author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  The Ghosts and Other Lectures
Quote: I will not attack your doctrines nor your creeds if they accord liberty to me. If they hold thought to be dangerous - if they aver that doubt is a crime, then I attack them one and all, because they enslave the minds of men.I attack the monsters, the phantoms of imagination that have ruled the world. I attack slavery. I ask for room -- room for the human mind.

Author: Ambrose Bierce
Quote: Mayonnaise: One of the sauces which serve the French in place of a state religion.

Author: Donald Barthelme
Quote: The death of God left the angels in a strange position.

Author: Cornel West
Quote: To be a Christian is to live dangerously, honestly, freely - to step in the name of love as if you may land on nothing, yet to keep on stepping because the something that sustains you no empire can give you and no empire can take away.

Author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values
Quote: …the doctrinal differences between Hinduism and Buddhism and Taoism are not anywhere near as important as doctrinal differences among Christianity and Islam and Judaism. Holy wars are not fought over them because verbalized statements about reality are never presumed to be reality itself.

Author: Erich Fromm,  Psychoanalysis and Religion
Quote: There is nothing inhuman, evil, or irrational which does not give some comfort, provided it is shared by a group.

Author: Stephen King,  Joyland
Quote: I can't understand why people use religion to hurt each other when there's already so much pain in the world.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; My God, my strength, in whom I will trust; My shield, and the horn of my salvation; my stronghold.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: He who defends with love will be secure; Heaven will save him, and protect him with love.

Author: Flannery O'Connor,  The Habit of Being: Letters of Flannery O'Connor
Quote: Children know by instinct that hell is an absence of love, and they can pick out theirs without missing.

Author: ابن قيم الجوزية
Quote: عليك بالمطالب العالية والمراتب السامية التي لا تنال إلا بطاعة الله، فإن الله عز وجل قضى أن لا ينال ما عنده إلا بطاعته. ومن كان لله كما يريد كان الله له فوق ما يريد، فمن أقبل عليه تلقاه من بعيد، ومن تصرف بحوله وقوته ألان له الحديد، ومن ترك لأجله أعطاه فوق المزيد، ومن أراد مراده الديني أراد ما يريد

Author: Robert M. Pirsig
Quote: Like those in the valley behind us, most people stand in sight of the spiritual mountains all their lives and never enter them, being content to listen to others who have been there and thus avoid the hardships.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Kindness has no religion. Religions are like narrow tracks but kindness is like an open sky.

Author: Johann Hari
Quote: I respect you as a person too much to respect your ridiculous beliefs.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: If God would have wanted us to live in a permissive society He would have given us Ten Suggestions and not Ten Commandments.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..
Quote: I found your love like I found religion: in an aluminum trashcan in the middle of the Utah desert.

Author: Gloria Steinem,  The Vagina Monologues
Quote: No wonder male religious leaders so often say that humans were born in sin—because we were born to female creatures. Only by obeying the rules of the patriarchy can we be reborn through men. No wonder priests and ministers in skirts sprinkle imitation birth fluid over our heads, give us new names, and promise rebirth into everlasting life.

Author: Rumi
Quote: در غم ما روزها بی گاه شدروزها با سوزها همراه شد

Author: Wally Lamb
Quote: Religion's just a well-oiled profit-driven denial of the randomness of it all.

Author: Thomas Paine,  The Age of Reason
Quote: Is it more probable that nature should go out of her course or that a man should tell a lie? We have never seen, in our time, nature go out of her course. But we have good reason to believe that millions of lies have been told in the same time. It is therefore at least millions to one that the reporter of a miracle tells a lie.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: I always like a dog so long as he isn't spelled backward.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Human, All Too Human
Quote: As soon as a religion comes to dominate it has as its opponents all those who would have been its first disciples.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Till We Have Faces
Quote: I ended my first book with the words 'no answer.' I know now, Lord, why you utter no answer. You are yourself the answer. Before your face questions die away. What other answer would suffice? Only words, words; to be led out to battle against other words.

Author: Louie Giglio
Quote: But to mean it when I say that I want my life to count for His glory is to drive a stake through the heart of self - a painful and determined dying to me that must be a part of every day I live.

Author: Sujiwo Tejo,  Lupa Endonesa
Quote: Intinya, bagimana sembahyang itu bisa mendorong seluruh hatimu untuk menolong orang lain. Itulah inti pergi ke masjid, gereja, wihara, kuil, dan sebagainya.

Author: Joris-Karl Huysmans
Quote: Worshiping the Devil is no more insane than worshiping God...It is precisely at the moment when positivism is at its high-water mark that mysticism stirs into life and the follies of occultism begin.

Author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  Some Mistakes of Moses
Quote: And why does this same God tell me how to raise my children when he had to drown his?

Author: Plotinus
Quote: I am striving to give back the Divine in myself to the Divine in the All.

Author: David Hume
Quote: It is an absurdity to believe that the Deity has human passions, and one of the lowest of human passions, a restless appetite for applause

Author: Joseph Campbell,  Thou Art That: Transforming Religious Metaphor
Quote: There seem to be only two kinds of people: Those who think that metaphors are facts, and those who know that they are not facts. Those who know they are not facts are what we call "atheists,"and those who think they are facts are "religious."Which group really gets the message?

Author: Aristotle
Quote: A tyrant must put on the appearance of uncommon devotion to religion. Subjects are less apprehensive of illegal treatment from a ruler whom they consider god-fearing and pious. On the other hand, they do less easily move against him, believing that he has the gods on his side.

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: If faith is what you have to go on, if faith is the link between your beliefs and the world at large, your beliefs are very likely to be wrong. Beliefs can be right or wrong. If you believe you can fly, that belief is only true if indeed you can fly. Somebody who thinks he can fly, and is wrong about it, will eventually discover there's a problem with his view of the world.

Author: John Piper,  The Passion of Jesus Christ
Quote: Don't follow a defeated foe. Follow Christ. It is costly. You will be an exile in this age. But you will be free.

Author: ابن قيم الجوزية,  الفوائد
Quote: تذكر حلاوة الوصال يهن عليك مر المجاهدة

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: They are trying to make me into a fixed star. I am an irregular planet.

Author: Meister Eckhart
Quote: Some people want to see God with their eyes as they see a cow, and to love Him as they love a cow - for the milk and cheese and profit it brings them. This is how it is with people who love God for the sake of outward wealth or inward comfort. They do not rightly love God, when they love Him for their own advantage.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Truth, in matters of religion, is simply the opinion that has survived.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: I said to my children, 'I'm going to work and do everything that I can do to see that you get a good education. I don't ever want you to forget that there are millions of God's children who will not and cannot get a good education, and I don't want you feeling that you are better than they are. For you will never be what you ought to be until they are what they ought to be.

Author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons
Quote: It seemed there was always a close correlation between true believers and high body counts.

Author: Dallas Willard,  The Spirit of the Disciplines : Understanding How God Changes Lives
Quote: The world can no longer be left to mere diplomats, politicians, and business leaders. They have done the best they could, no doubt. But this is an age for spiritual heroes- a time for men and women to be heroic in their faith and in spiritual character and power. The greatest danger to the Christian church today is that of pitching its message too low.

Author: مصطفى محمود,  رحلتي من الشك إلى الإيمان
Quote: بالحُبّ خَلَق، وللحب خَلَق، وللحب يُعذِّب ... تبارك وتعالى في سمواته، الذي خلقنا باسمه الرحمن الرحيم

Author: Flannery O'Connor,  Mystery and Manners: Occasional Prose
Quote: Your beliefs will be the light by which you see, but they will not be what you see and they will not be a substitute for seeing.

Author: Margaret Atwood,  Der blinde Mörder
Quote: A Paradox, the doughnut hole. Empty space, once, but now they've learned to market even that. A minus quantity; nothing, rendered edible. I wondered if they might be used-metaphorically, of course-to demonstrate the existence of God. Does naming a sphere of nothingness transmute it into being?

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
Quote: When you see a man with a great deal of religion displayed in his shop window, you may depend upon it he keeps a very small stock of it within.

Author: Alexandra Adornetto,  Halo
Quote: I have church on Sunday.”“Of course you do.”“You’re welcome to come along.”“Thanks, but I’m allergic to incense.”“That’s a shame.”“It’s the bane of my existence.”- Beth and Jake

Author: Jonathan Edwards
Quote: He that has doctrinal knowledge and speculation only, without affection, never is engaged in the business of religion.

Author: George Carlin,  When Will Jesus Bring the Pork Chops?
Quote: To my way of thinking, there is every bit as much evidence for theexistence of UFOs as there is for the existence of God. Probably farmore. At least in the case of UFOs there have been countless tapedand filmed and, by the way, unexplained sightings from all over theworld, along with documented radar evidence seen by experiencedmilitary and civilian radar operators.>>

Author: Tim Minchin
Quote: Science adjusts its views based on what's observedFaith is the denial of observation so that belief can be preserved.

Author: ابن قيم الجوزية
Quote: المعصية تورث الذل ولا بد, فإن العز كل العز في طاعة الله تعالى.قال تعالى: {من كان يريد العزة فلله العزة جميعا}أي : فليطلبها بطاعة الله, فإنه لا يجدها إلا في طاعته. وكان دعاء بعض السلف اللهم أعزني بطاعتك, ولا تذلني بمعصيتك

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: For the wages of sin is Death, but the gift of God is everlasting Life in Christ Jesus or LORD.

Author: Bill Maher
Quote: The Bible looks like it started out as a game of mad libs.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Carpe Jugulum
Quote: You say that you people don’t burn folk and sacrifice people anymore, but that’s what true faith would mean, y’see? Sacrificin’ your own life, one day at a time, to the flame, declarin’ the truth of it, workin’ for it, breathin’ the soul of it. That’s religion. Anything else is just . . . is just bein’ nice. And a way of keepin’ in touch with the neighbors.

Author: Michael Shermer
Quote: There are many sources of spirituality; religion may be the most common, but it is by no means the only. Anything that generates a sense of awe may be a source of spirituality. Science does this in spades.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: down with hell and heaven and all the religious fussinfinity pleased our parents one inch looks good to us

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary
Quote: Once you have surrendered yourself, you make yourself receptive. In receiving from God, you are perfected and completed.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir
Quote: Your least favorite virtue, or nominee for the most overrated one? Faith. Closely followed—in view of the overall shortage of time—by patience.

Author: Hector Avalos
Quote: By Hays' reasoning, penetrating a rectum with a penis is a violation of how God meant humans to function. However, penetrating a human body with a sword, a common way to kill people in biblical times, is acceptable. Apparently human bodies were designed to be penetrated by metal implements, but not by flesh.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: You know who I pray to? Joe Pesci. Two reasons: First of all, I think he's a good actor, okay? To me, that counts. Second, he looks like a guy who can get things done. Joe Pesci doesn't fuck around. In fact, Joe Pesci came through on a couple of things that God was having trouble with.

Author: Joseph Smith Jr.
Quote: You don't know me; you never knew my heart. No man knows my history. I cannot tell it: I shall never undertake it. I don't blame any one for not believing my history. If I had not experienced what I have, I would not have believed it myself. I never did harm any man since I was born in the world. My voice is always for peace.

Author: Rob Bell,  Sex God: Exploring the Endless Connections Between Sexuality and Spirituality
Quote: The danger is that in reaction to abuses and distortions of an idea, we'll reject it completely. And in the process miss out on the good of it, the worth of it, the truth of it.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: In the midst of the affliction He counsels, strengthens confirms, nourishes, and favors us.... More over, when we have repented, He instantly remits the sins as well as the punishments. In the same manner parents ought to handle their children.

Author: Harshit Walia
Quote: Whole life is a search for beauty. But, when the beauty is found inside, the search ends and a beautiful journey begins.

Author: William James
Quote: If merely 'feeling good' could decide, drunkenness would be the supremely valid human experience.

Author: Charles C. Ryrie
Quote: The Bible is the greatest of all books; to study it is the noblest of all pursuits; to understand it, the highest of all goals.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina
Quote: If goodness has causes, it is not goodness; if it has effects, a reward, it is not goodness either. So goodness is outside the chain of cause and effect.

Author: Daniel Radcliffe
Quote: I’m an atheist, and a militant atheist when religion starts impacting on legislation.

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: The faith of religion is belief on insufficient evidence.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Religion is the opium of the poor

Author: Lee Ezell
Quote: Pray to God, but row towards shore.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: What looks like politics, and imagines itself to be political, will one day unmask itself as a religious movement.

Author: Ron Sanders
Quote: CONCERNED BUT NOT CONSUMED!

Author: Chris Hedges,  American Fascists: The Christian Right and the War on America
Quote: The split in America, rather than simply economic, is between those who embrace reason, who function in the real world of cause and effect, and those who, numbed by isolation and despair, now seek meaning in a mythical world of intuition, a world that is no longer reality-based, a world of magic.

Author: Christopher Hitchens
Quote: I have been called arrogant myself in my time, and hope to earn the title again, but to claim that I am privy to the secrets of the universe and its creator - that's beyond my conceit.

Author: Tom Robbins,  Jitterbug Perfume
Quote: salvation is for the feeble, that's what I think. I don't want salvation, I want life, all of life, the miserable as well as the superb.

Author: Scott Hahn,  Lord, Have Mercy: The Healing Power of Confession
Quote: We...sin not because we want what is evil, but because we want what isn't good enough.

Author: Helen Keller,  The Story of My Life
Quote: It is wonderful how much time good people spend fighting the devil. If they would only expend the same amount of energy loving their fellow men, the devil would die in his own tracks of ennui.

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: What we do in every other area of our lives (other than religion), is, rather than respect somebody's beliefs, we evaluate their reasons.

Author: حنان اللحام,  هدي السيرة النبوية في التغيير الاجتماعي
Quote: من لم يتحرر من الاكراه في صورتيه: اكراه الاخر والخضوع للاخر، لايستطيع فهم هذا الدين وتمثيله

Author: Ruth Hurmence Green,  The Born Again Skeptic's Guide To The Bible
Quote: I am now convinced that children should not be subjected to the frightfulness of the Christian religion [...]. If the concept of a father who plots to have his own son put to death is presented to children as beautiful and as worthy of society's admiration, what types of human behavior can be presented to them as reprehensible?

Author: ابن قيم الجوزية
Quote: إرجع إلى الله واطلبه من عينك وسمعك وقلبك ولسانك, ولا تشرد عنه من هذه الأربعة؛ فما رجع من رجع إليه بتوفيقه إلا منها , وما شرد من شرد عنه بخذلانه إلا منها

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Small Gods
Quote: The trouble with being a god is that you've got no one to pray to.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: Religion is for those who don't want to go to hell, and spirituality is for those who have already been there.

Author: Deb Caletti,  The Nature of Jade
Quote: They say religion is about love, but you wonder how much of it really is about fear.

Author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons
Quote: Science tells me God must exist.My mind tells me I'll never understand God.My heart tells me I'm not meant to. [Vittoria Vetra]

Author: Anne Lamott,  Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
Quote: Mine was a patchwork God, sewn together from bits of rag and ribbon, Eastern and Western, pagan and Hebrew, everything but the kitchen sink and Jesus.

Author: Emil Cioran
Quote: Think of God and not religion, of ecstasy and not mysticism. The difference between the theoretician of faith and the believer is as great as between the psychiatrist and the psychotic.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Senses of humor define people, as factions, deeper rooted than religious or political opinions. When carrying out everyday tasks, opinions are rather easy to set aside, but those whom a person shares a sense of humor with are his closest friends. They are always there to make the biggest influence.

Author: Christopher Hitchens
Quote: Indeed, it's futile to try and use Holy Scripture to support any political position. I deeply distrust anyone who does. Just look at what an Islamic Republic is like.

Author: Brian Cox
Quote: The problem with today’s world is that everyone believes they have the right to express their opinion AND have others listen to it. The correct statement of individual rights is that everyone has the right to an opinion, but crucially, that opinion can be roundly ignored and even made fun of, particularly if it is demonstrably nonsense!

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: An honest religious thinker is like a tightrope walker. He almost looks as though he were walking on nothing but air. His support is the slenderest imaginable. And yet it really is possible to walk on it.

Author: Brad Pitt
Quote: I'm probably 20 percent atheist and 80 percent agnostic. I don't think anyone really knows. You'll either find out or not when you get there, until then there's no point thinking about it.

Author: Laura Pedersen,  Best Bet
Quote: Coincidence is God's way of being anonymous.

Author: H.G. Wells,  The War of the Worlds
Quote: Be a man!... What good is religion if it collapses under calamity? Think of what earthquakes and floods, wars and volcanoes, have done before to men! Did you think that God had exempted [us]? He is not an insurance agent.

Author: Ilona Andrews,  Fate's Edge
Quote: Jack didn’t fully get Jesus. Audrey tried to explain it, and he could repeat it back to her, word for word, but he still didn’t comprehend most of it. The best he could gather was that Jesus lived long ago, told people to be nice, and they killed him for it. At the end, he asked who was Jesus’ necromancer and if he was in the Bible, then Kaldar couldn’t stop laughing and had to sit down.

Author: Seraphim Rose,  Nihilism: The Root of the Revolution of the Modern Age
Quote: Atheism, true 'existential' atheism burning with hatred of a seemingly unjust or unmerciful God, is a spiritual state; it is a real attempt to grapple with the true God.… Nietzsche, in calling himself Antichrist, proved thereby his intense hunger for Christ.

Author: Karl Rahner,  The Need and the Blessing of Prayer
Quote: When man is with God in awe and love, then he is praying.

Author: Gary Parker
Quote: If faith never encounters doubt, if truth never struggles with error, if good never battles evil, how can faith know its own power? In my own pilgrimage, if I had to choose between a faith that has stared doubt in the eye and made it blink, or a naive faith that has never known the firing line of doubt, I will choose the former every time.

Author: Lance Armstrong
Quote: If there was a god, I'd still have both nuts.

Author: David Eagleman,  Sum: Forty Tales from the Afterlives
Quote: It is only through us that God lives. When we abandon him, he dies.
